Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: MIDDLE KINGDOM (not after); 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before)
Name: Bowl
Description: Vase in the shape of a bowl with a flat circular base. The body widens gradually towards the top then, at 1 cm from the exterior extremity, it inflects slightly. Throwing marks are quite obvious on the interior. There are occasional white specks, both on the interior and the exterior.
